This is a refactor, we can easily add more test cases and reuse the framework in future.
@dbarashinvd could you please review? Thanks.

Sure
@ysmanman @sanmalho-git for viz.
cc @vperumal for viz.
Hi @msosyak, I made the changes to code formatting that were talked about in #5639
Thanks, appreciate it.

Just FYI, @abdosi @bingwang-ms 
This failed is introduced by this PR (https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/6945) for missing M0 type

Hi @Blueve, I found there is a bug in this PR. From [port_utils.py](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/ansible/module_utils/port_utils.py) we can see many platforms are using `Ethernet*` as both port name and alias (for example, `Ethernet1` appears in both port names and alias on platform `Arista-7050-QX-32S`). So, it's hard for me to tell if `Ethernet*` in link.csv is a name or an alias.

And BTW.
add below two enhance in this PR:
- output more stats info in the test report for debug purpose.
- correct dest MAC address for dualtor case.

@ZhaohuiS
Could you please take a look ?
@AndriiLozovyi Thanks, this change makes senses.
cc @vperumal for viz.

@gollarharsha @rraghav-cisco @wangxin take a look please

@antonptashnik , I understand that you can save time by not checking previously checked routes. But it is part of the tests to check every route after every modification to the route table. What if some routes stop functioning after modifications by testcases ? Pls confirm this with @prsunny and @siqbal1986 before going ahead.
i think we can live without the redundant checking after every test case. This will improve the performance of the test.

> Can we set "skip" action for non-real dual tor? don't run ecn test for single tor and emulated dual tor.

test_tor_ecn will not run signal tor, since it defines `pytest.mark.topology("dualtor")` in the beginning of script. Non dualtor will skip this script.

the issue reported by pre-commit is caused by specific structure of .yaml test skip files which allow several `skip` reasons to be specified within the same section, like below:
```
platform_tests/broadcom/test_ser.py:
  skip:
    reason: "platform does not support test_ser"
    conditions:
      - "platform in ['x86_64-cel_e1031-r0']"
      - https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/issues/6218
  skip:
    reason: "test_ser is only supported for Broadcom"
    conditions:
      - "asic_type not in ['broadcom']"
```
